alert.note: Alert for Marion (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 01 at 9:42PM CST by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Marion County through 1030 PM CST... At 941 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Fairview, or 9 miles southwest of Red Bay, moving east at 65 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Hamilton, Hackleburg, Weston, Brinn, Bear Creek, Tessner, Bexar, Pigeye, Shottsville and Upper Bear Creek Reservoir. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Birmingham. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CST for northwestern Alabama.
